posts.title: New Waves in Cinema
posts.excerpt: The term New Wave conjures up images of Paris in the early 1960s from the films of French filmmakers Jean-Luc Godard and François Truffaut. posts._title: Roberto Rossellini – Dov’è la libertà…? AKA Where is Freedom? (1954)
posts.title: Dov’è la libertà…?
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: A barber, murderer because of jealousy, spends twenty years in jail. He cannot, however adjust himself to a changed world and to the hypocracy of his own relatives and decides to return behind bars. — IMDb.
